logic

Class Logic

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Maze
      • logic.Logic

  • public class Logic
extends Maze
    Logic is the class involved in managing and validation of the movement by different Characters and update the game State accordingly.
    Author:
    André Pinheiro, José Peixoto, Paulo Faria

    • Method Detail

      • playGame

        public java.lang.String[] playGame(java.lang.String userInput)
        Processes the moves related to the game according to the input and game initial configuration variables.
        Parameters:
        userInput - the String previously entered by the player used to attempt to move the hero
        Returns:
        message String[] used to display relevant game events

      • moveHero

        public java.lang.String moveHero(java.lang.String userInput,
                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Boolean> moves)
        Processes a valid hero move and deals with possible hero related game events.
        Parameters:
        userInput - the String previously entered by the player used to attempt to move the hero
        moves - HashMap previously generated only containing valid hero moves
        Returns:
        message String used to display relevant Hero events

      • moveDragon

        public java.lang.String moveDragon(Dragon dragon)
        Processes a valid dragon move and deals with possible dragon related game events.
        Parameters:
        dragon - one object of the class Dragon from the ArrayList dragons
        Returns:
        message String used to display relevant dragon events

      • moveEagle

        public java.lang.String moveEagle()
        Processes a valid eagle move and deals with possible eagle related game events.
        Returns:
        message String used to display relevant eagle events

      • checkGame

        public State checkGame()
        Processes the possible game consequences after a round of Character movements.
        Returns:
        State of the game after every Character movement is taken into account

      • validHeroMoves

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Boolean> validHeroMoves()
        Checks each of the 4 directions near the hero for valid positions adding them to the HashMap validMoves.
        Returns:
        HashMap validMoves with possible positions for hero to move into

      • nearDragon

        public Dragon nearDragon()
        Checks for dragons near the hero.
        Returns:
        Dragon object near the hero or null if inexistent

      • dragonAtSword

        public boolean dragonAtSword(Dragon dragon)
        Checks if given Dragon is at the sword position.
        Parameters:
        dragon - one object of the class Dragon from the ArrayList dragons
        Returns:
        boolean true if dragon is at the sword position or false otherwise
